title: 13 Best Sleeper Sofas in 2025 That Are Sturdy and Stylish, Tested
author: Audrey Lee, Lori Keong
excerpt: The best sleeper sofas turn any living space into an impromptu bedroom. Our editors' list includes picks from Article, Apt. 2B, Benchmade, and beyond

By night, they can transform into comfortable lodging for family, friends, or weary visitors who’ve stopped by for a sleepover. And while you may not think of them as the sexiest furnishings on the market, we’re here to respectfully disagree. Made-to-order items are not eligible.And remember that not every sleeper sofa has to look like your standard sectional or loveseat. The neutral-hued Pottery Barn daybed above is ideal for any nursery that needs a sofa which can convert to a sleeping surface when you’re in most need of some shut-eye (new moms and dads, looking at you). This one works for small spaces, too, since it folds down flat on the floor to create a queen-sized sleeping space, rather than requiring any mechanical set-up for an internal bed.What to consider when buying a sleeper sofaWhat kind of a sleeper sofa are you looking for?There are three main types of sleeper sofas in the world: Futon-style couches are a less bulky and heavy option where the cushions of the couch fold down to become a surface for sleeping. Pull-out couches are the most traditional and also the heaviest, as they contain a full mattress within an inner cavity, combined with the couch itself. For those, you'll probably want to request white-glove delivery if you can afford it, as they'll require some huffing and puffing to transport it into your house. Technically a long chaise or daybed can also function as sleeper sofas, but since those could fall into a separate category, we mostly tested the two former options for this story.How much room do you have in your home?Space is one of the biggest considerations you'll have to weigh when you're shopping for couches. Depending on the size of your guest room, you may have the square footage for a sprawling pull-out style couch, or need to make do with a fold-down futon for an area with a smaller footprint. Always, always, always measure the designated space you want to slot your new couch (along with your doors!) before trying to squeeze something past the threshold of your home that just won't fit.How much support do you need?Compared to, say, an air mattress (which can be saggy and provide uneven support), a sleeper sofa is typically going to be much more comfortable for your guests to sleep on. It all boils down to the kind of sleeper you are and what support you value, though. Some sleepers might prefer a couch without the dreaded support bar propping up the bed in a pull-out sofa, while others need a real springs-and-all mattress rather than a bricklike futon to lay back on. Consider what types of support you might need in our primer on how to shop for a mattress.How We TestedThere are many factors that went into each of our reviews to give you the insight you need to select the best sleeper sofa for your home. Here's a peek at our thought process for these standardized reviews we run:Ordering and Customization Process: Price points, shallow or deep seats, armrests or armless, down seat and back cushions or foam cushioning, and which upholstery to choose—each of the sofas we tested has possibilities. We also documented the lead times and expected delivery timelines for each model.Couch Delivery and Assembly: Curbside or white-glove delivery, fully assembled or DIY. And, if DIY, how many pieces did the sofa arrive in, and how difficult was the assembly?After Installation: We asked some tough functionality questions of each sofa: Is it practical for a modern home? Is the couch kid and/or pet friendly? What are the care and cleaning instructions? And did it look better in real life than in the photos?Pullout Process: We wanted to know just how easy it is to turn these sofas into makeshift mattresses. We asked our testers how difficult it was to figure out how to convert their seats to sleeper mode and how much physical strength it required.Sleep Test: The big question we wanted to answer: Just how well can you sleep on a sleeper sofa? We grilled our testers on what it’s actually like to spend multiple nights snoozing on these bad boys. How plush or firm did the pullout mattress feel? What was the mattress type? Does the couch easily convert into sleeper mode? Is it actually comfortable?How We ChoseOn our pursuit for the perfect sleeper sofa, we prioritized picks that were above all comfortable to sleep on, plus elegant enough to suit our testers’ aesthetics (anything that didn’t make at least a B- for all of the criteria above was not mentioned in our piece at all). Our top choices were also couches that shipped out quickly and weren’t a complete nightmare to set up, factoring in that more custom pieces could take slightly longer to produce).Over the years since we first started testing out sleeper sofas, we delisted picks from brands like EQ3 that felt overly cost-prohibitive for the quality, and anything else that was no longer in stock. And because we haven’t had the chance to test out every iteration of sleeper sofa on the market just yet, we included a section of alternative picks for shoppers that our team is either in the process of testing right now, or think you should know about based on style and brand reputation.Don’t Sleep on More Seat Week Content:Check out a few Clever classics that’ll help you sit back and relax.AD’s Seat Week 2024: An essential furniture guide to the best sofas, sectionals, chairs, and moreThe Best Office Chairs: Ergonomic picks tested and reviewed from Herman Miller, Knoll, Amazon, and moreThe Very Best Sectional Sofas, Tested and Reviewed: We shipped the top sectional sofas—left and right chaises, armless, modular, and MCM models from burrow, pottery barn, west Elm, and more—into the homes of Clever contributors to test them firsthandBest Affordable Couch Options That Don’t Skimp on Style: We scoured the internet for beautifully designed couches, all under $2,000Best Leather Sofas for Stylish Spaces: We’re breaking leather sofas out of the bachelor pad starter kitBest Outdoor Sofas to Define Your Exterior Space: Seats and recliners for a poolside oasis, shade-laden backyard, or tight-fitting balcony

Contributor Mackenzie Chung Fegan told us the “minimalist Nordby Sofa Bed is attractively priced and easy to convert, with a pullout component that slides into place next to the sofa seat and forms a mattress roughly the size of a full-size pullout bed.” If you’re a fan of firm mattresses and have a smaller space, this sofa may just be perfect for you, though Chung Fegan warns that the seat depth “feels ungenerous,” and the extra firm seat cushions don’t lend themselves exceptionally well to sitting comfortably.

What to consider when buying a sleeper sofa

What kind of a sleeper sofa are you looking for?

There are three main types of sleeper sofas in the world: Futon-style couches are a less bulky and heavy option where the cushions of the couch fold down to become a surface for sleeping. Pull-out couches are the most traditional and also the heaviest, as they contain a full mattress within an inner cavity, combined with the couch itself. For those, you'll probably want to request white-glove delivery if you can afford it, as they'll require some huffing and puffing to transport it into your house. Technically a long chaise or daybed can also function as sleeper sofas, but since those could fall into a separate category, we mostly tested the two former options for this story.

How much room do you have in your home?

Space is one of the biggest considerations you'll have to weigh when you're shopping for couches. Depending on the size of your guest room, you may have the square footage for a sprawling pull-out style couch, or need to make do with a fold-down futon for an area with a smaller footprint. Always, always, always measure the designated space you want to slot your new couch (along with your doors!) before trying to squeeze something past the threshold of your home that just won't fit.

How much support do you need?

Compared to, say, an air mattress (which can be saggy and provide uneven support), a sleeper sofa is typically going to be much more comfortable for your guests to sleep on. It all boils down to the kind of sleeper you are and what support you value, though. Some sleepers might prefer a couch without the dreaded support bar propping up the bed in a pull-out sofa, while others need a real springs-and-all mattress rather than a bricklike futon to lay back on. Consider what types of support you might need in our primer on how to shop for a mattress.

How We Tested

There are many factors that went into each of our reviews to give you the insight you need to select the best sleeper sofa for your home. Here's a peek at our thought process for these standardized reviews we run:

Ordering and Customization Process: Price points, shallow or deep seats, armrests or armless, down seat and back cushions or foam cushioning, and which upholstery to choose—each of the sofas we tested has possibilities. We also documented the lead times and expected delivery timelines for each model.

Couch Delivery and Assembly: Curbside or white-glove delivery, fully assembled or DIY. And, if DIY, how many pieces did the sofa arrive in, and how difficult was the assembly?

After Installation: We asked some tough functionality questions of each sofa: Is it practical for a modern home? Is the couch kid and/or pet friendly? What are the care and cleaning instructions? And did it look better in real life than in the photos?

Pullout Process: We wanted to know just how easy it is to turn these sofas into makeshift mattresses. We asked our testers how difficult it was to figure out how to convert their seats to sleeper mode and how much physical strength it required.

Sleep Test: The big question we wanted to answer: Just how well can you sleep on a sleeper sofa? We grilled our testers on what it’s actually like to spend multiple nights snoozing on these bad boys. How plush or firm did the pullout mattress feel? What was the mattress type? Does the couch easily convert into sleeper mode? Is it actually comfortable?

How We Chose

On our pursuit for the perfect sleeper sofa, we prioritized picks that were above all comfortable to sleep on, plus elegant enough to suit our testers’ aesthetics (anything that didn’t make at least a B- for all of the criteria above was not mentioned in our piece at all). Our top choices were also couches that shipped out quickly and weren’t a complete nightmare to set up, factoring in that more custom pieces could take slightly longer to produce).

Over the years since we first started testing out sleeper sofas, we delisted picks from brands like EQ3 that felt overly cost-prohibitive for the quality, and anything else that was no longer in stock.
